Candide.translation[0].definitions[0].de: (1759) a book by the French writer Voltaire which is a satire (=humorous criticism) on the belief that ‘everything is for the best in the best of all possible worlds’. Candide is a young man who is taught to be an optimist, but his experiences show him how bad life is, and he decides that it is best to ‘cultivate  (=look after) one’s own garden’.
